text: <@UNWHHSWHJ> hope this is a node application and I always solve this by
take note of the `<https://www.example.com>`  that you are sending the data from
Hey Thanks, but right now i am trying to do this with HubSpot and it not working because HubSpot not support CORS <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/do-HubSpot-apis-support-ajax-request>

I would advise you not to perform the request on the browser as you will expose the API key to the public. The example above works best if you are using Google Functions as server side code that will be receiving the post request from AJAX.

Let me know if you need help in creating a Google Function and writing a script that will send the query.

Great! will ping you if need any help :simple_smile:
thanks :thumbsup:
